global.title: Global Settings
global.description: Manage Nginx global settings. Nginx will automatically reload after saving changes.

balanced.label: Balanced
balanced.description: Standard balanced configuration. Suitable for most cases.

performance.label: Performance
performance.description: High performance configuration. Optimized for high traffic and fast responses.

security.label: Security
security.description: Security hardened configuration. Uses only modern TLS and adds security headers.

buffer.title: Proxy Buffer Settings
buffer.description: Configure how responses from upstream servers are buffered. Proper buffer sizing balances memory usage and performance.

performance.tips: Tip: If proxy buffer size is too small, responses will be written to temporary files, causing disk I/O. Increasing buffer size improves performance for large responses. Open File Cache caches file descriptors for static files to improve performance.

worker_processes.label: Worker Processes
worker_processes.description: Number of worker processes handling requests. 0 = auto-detect based on CPU cores. Higher values improve concurrency.

worker_connections.label: Worker Connections
worker_connections.description: Maximum number of simultaneous connections per worker process. Higher values allow more concurrent connections.

multi_accept.label: Multi Accept
multi_accept.description: If enabled, a worker will accept all new connections at once. Improves performance under high traffic.

use_epoll.label: Use Epoll
use_epoll.description: Use efficient event processing method (epoll) on Linux. Improves performance with many concurrent connections.

keepalive_timeout.label: Keepalive Timeout (s)
keepalive_timeout.description: Time to keep connections alive. Allows clients to reuse connections for multiple requests.

keepalive_requests.label: Keepalive Requests
keepalive_requests.description: Maximum number of requests that can be served through a single keepalive connection.

client_max_body_size.label: Max Body Size
client_max_body_size.description: Maximum allowed size of the client request body (e.g., 100m, 1g). Affects file upload limits.

types_hash_max_size.label: Types Hash Size
types_hash_max_size.description: Maximum size of the MIME types hash table. Default is usually sufficient.

sendfile.label: Sendfile
sendfile.description: Use sendfile() system call to transfer files directly in the kernel. Improves static file serving speed.

tcp_nopush.label: TCP Nopush
tcp_nopush.description: Use in conjunction with sendfile. Sends response header and file content in one packet.

tcp_nodelay.label: TCP Nodelay
tcp_nodelay.description: Disable Nagle algorithm. Sends small packets immediately. Useful for real-time applications.

server_tokens.label: Server Tokens
server_tokens.description: If enabled, Nginx version is shown in response headers. Recommended to disable for security.

gzip_enabled.label: Gzip Compression
gzip_enabled.description: Compress responses with Gzip. Saves bandwidth and improves page load speed.

gzip_comp_level.label: Compression Level (1-9)
gzip_comp_level.description: Compression strength. Higher means better compression but more CPU usage. Recommended: 5-6.

gzip_min_length.label: Min Compression Length (bytes)
gzip_min_length.description: Responses smaller than this will not be compressed. Compressing tiny files can be inefficient.

gzip_types.label: Compression MIME Types
gzip_types.description: List of MIME types to compress. Effective for text-based content (HTML, CSS, JS, JSON, etc.).

gzip_vary.label: Add Vary Header
gzip_vary.description: Adds 'Vary: Accept-Encoding' header. Ensures CDNs/caches serve the correct version.

brotli_enabled.label: Brotli Compression
brotli_enabled.description: Enable Brotli compression. Provides higher compression ratio than Gzip. Supported by modern browsers.

brotli_static.label: Brotli Static
brotli_static.description: Serve pre-compressed .br files if available. Reduces CPU overhead for static assets.

brotli_comp_level.label: Brotli Level (1-11)
brotli_comp_level.description: Brotli compression strength. 1-4: Fast, 5-9: Balanced, 10-11: Max (High CPU). Recommended: 4-6.

brotli_min_length.label: Brotli Min Length
brotli_min_length.description: Minimum response size (bytes) to apply Brotli compression. Small files don't benefit from compression.

brotli_types.label: Brotli MIME Types
brotli_types.description: List of MIME types to compress with Brotli. Most effective for text-based content.

ssl_protocols.label: SSL Protocols
ssl_protocols.description: Allowed TLS protocol versions. TLSv1.2 and TLSv1.3 are recommended for security.

ssl_ciphers.label: SSL Ciphers
ssl_ciphers.description: List of enabled cipher suites. Balance between security and compatibility.

ssl_session_cache.label: SSL Session Cache
ssl_session_cache.description: Cache SSL sessions to speed up reconnects by skipping handshake.

ssl_session_timeout.label: SSL Session Timeout
ssl_session_timeout.description: Validity period of SSL session cache. e.g., 1d (1 day), 1h (1 hour).

ssl_prefer_server_ciphers.label: Prefer Server Ciphers
ssl_prefer_server_ciphers.description: Use server's preferred cipher suites instead of client's. Recommended for stronger security.

ssl_stapling.label: OCSP Stapling
ssl_stapling.description: Cache certificate status on server to speed up client connection verification.

ssl_stapling_verify.label: Stapling Verify
ssl_stapling_verify.description: Verify OCSP response. Used with ssl_stapling.

ssl_session_tickets.label: Session Tickets
ssl_session_tickets.description: Enable TLS session tickets for session resumption. Reduces server load.

client_body_timeout.label: Client Body Timeout (s)
client_body_timeout.description: Timeout for reading client request body. Adjust for slow uploads.

client_header_timeout.label: Client Header Timeout (s)
client_header_timeout.description: Timeout for reading client request header. Protects against slow clients.

send_timeout.label: Send Timeout (s)
send_timeout.description: Timeout for transmitting response to client.

proxy_connect_timeout.label: Proxy Connect Timeout (s)
proxy_connect_timeout.description: Timeout for connecting to upstream server.

proxy_send_timeout.label: Proxy Send Timeout (s)
proxy_send_timeout.description: Timeout for sending request to upstream server.

proxy_read_timeout.label: Proxy Read Timeout (s)
proxy_read_timeout.description: Timeout for reading response from upstream server. Adjust for slow API responses.

resolver.label: DNS Resolver
resolver.description: DNS server for resolving domain names. e.g., 8.8.8.8 8.8.4.4 valid=300s

error_log_level.label: Error Log Level
error_log_level.description: Logging verbosity. 'debug' is most detailed, 'crit' is most concise.

access_log_enabled.label: Enable Access Log
access_log_enabled.description: Log all requests. High traffic may increase disk usage.

custom_http_config.label: Custom HTTP Config
custom_http_config.description: Directly input additional Nginx configuration. For advanced users.

proxy_buffer_size.label: Proxy Buffer Size
proxy_buffer_size.description: Buffer size for reading the first part (header) of upstream server response. Default: 8k

proxy_buffers.label: Proxy Buffers
proxy_buffers.description: Number and size of response buffers. Format: 'count size' (e.g., 8 32k)

proxy_busy_buffers_size.label: Busy Buffers Size
proxy_busy_buffers_size.description: Buffer size that can be sent to client while response is not fully read.

proxy_max_temp_file_size.label: Max Temp File Size
proxy_max_temp_file_size.description: Maximum size of temporary file for storing response when buffers are full. Set to 0 to disable temp files.

proxy_temp_file_write_size.label: Temp File Write Size
proxy_temp_file_write_size.description: Size of data that can be written to temporary file at once.

open_file_cache_enabled.label: Enable Open File Cache
open_file_cache_enabled.description: Cache open file descriptors and directory lookups. Improves performance for sites with many static files.

open_file_cache_max.label: Max Cache Entries
open_file_cache_max.description: Maximum number of entries to keep in cache.

open_file_cache_inactive.label: Inactive Time
open_file_cache_inactive.description: Entries not accessed within this time are removed from cache. (e.g., 20s, 60s)

open_file_cache_valid.label: Validation Interval
open_file_cache_valid.description: How often to check if cached entries are still valid. (e.g., 30s, 60s)

open_file_cache_min_uses.label: Minimum Uses
open_file_cache_min_uses.description: Only files accessed this many times are kept in cache.

open_file_cache_errors.label: Cache Errors
open_file_cache_errors.description: Also cache file-not-found errors. Improves performance for repeated requests to non-existent files.

reset_timedout_connection.label: Reset Timedout Connections
reset_timedout_connection.description: Close timed out connections with RST instead of FIN to immediately release sockets. Helps conserve server resources.

resolver_timeout.label: DNS Resolver Timeout
resolver_timeout.description: Maximum time to wait for DNS lookup response. (e.g., 30s)

custom_stream_config.label: Custom Stream Config
custom_stream_config.description: Nginx stream block configuration for TCP/UDP proxying. For advanced users.

tips.compression: Tip: Enabling both Gzip and Brotli allows browsers to automatically choose the best method. Brotli offers 20-30% better compression, but older browsers only support Gzip.

directIpAccess.title: Direct IP Access Handling
directIpAccess.description: Configure how to handle requests that access the server directly via IP without a domain. Direct IP access is mostly from bots or scanners.

allow.label: Show Nginx Proxy Guard Welcome Page
allow.description: Displays Nginx Proxy Guard welcome page when accessing via server IP. Useful for verifying server is running.

block403.label: Return 403 Forbidden
block403.description: Returns 403 Forbidden response with JSON access denied message.

block444.label: Close Connection (444)
block444.description: Immediately closes connection without response. Most effective against scanners.

note.title: Note
note.description: Health check (/health) and ACME challenge (/.well-known/acme-challenge/) are always allowed regardless of this setting.

ddos.title: DDoS Protection (Global)
ddos.description: Global DDoS protection settings applied to all hosts. Proxy Host-specific Rate Limits are applied in addition to these settings.

connectionLimit.title: Connection Limit
connectionLimit.description: Limit maximum simultaneous connections per IP.

requestLimit.title: Request Rate Limit
requestLimit.description: Limit requests per second per IP.

responseLimit.title: Response Rate Limit (Bandwidth)
responseLimit.description: Limit response speed to clients. 0 = unlimited

connectionReset.title: Timeout Connection Reset
connectionReset.description: Immediately reset timed out connections to release resources.

info.title: Difference from Proxy Host Rate Limit
info.description: These settings are **applied to all hosts by default**. Rate Limits configured in Proxy Hosts are **additionally applied** as more granular control for that specific host.

nginxConfNote.title: Note: nginx.conf level settings
nginxConfNote.description: The settings below (Reset Timedout Connection, Resolver Timeout, Custom Stream Config) are applied to the http/stream block in nginx.conf. A nginx restart is required for changes to take effect.

global.worker_processes: Number of Nginx worker processes. Set to 'auto' to match CPU cores. Matching core count is recommended for high traffic.
global.worker_connections: Max simultaneous connections per worker. Too low values can cause connection errors. (Default: 1024)
global.multi_accept: If enabled, workers accept multiple connections at once. Can improve performance under very high traffic.
global.use_epoll: Uses epoll, a high-performance event processing method on Linux. Essential for handling many concurrent connections.
global.keepalive_timeout: Time to keep connection alive. Too long wastes memory, too short causes reconnection overhead.
global.keepalive_requests: Max requests per keepalive connection. Connection closes after exceeding this limit.
global.client_max_body_size: Limits max upload file size. Increase this if you need to upload large files.
global.types_hash_max_size: Size of hash table for MIME types. Default is usually sufficient.
global.sendfile: Maximizes performance by transferring files at kernel level. Essential for static content.
global.tcp_nopush: Used with sendfile to reduce packet count and improve network efficiency.
global.tcp_nodelay: Sends small packets immediately to improve response speed. Beneficial for real-time apps.
global.server_tokens: Hiding Nginx version information is recommended for security.
global.gzip_enabled: Compresses text data (HTML, CSS, JS) to reduce transfer size. Greatly improves speed.
global.gzip_comp_level: Compression level. 5-6 offers best balance between CPU usage and efficiency.
global.gzip_min_length: Very small files are not compressed as it offers no benefit.
global.gzip_types: File types to compress. Images/videos are already compressed so better to exclude them.
global.gzip_vary: Adds Vary header so cache servers distinguish compressed vs uncompressed versions.
global.brotli_enabled: Uses Google's Brotli compression. Higher compression ratio than Gzip.
global.brotli_types: Content types to compress with Brotli.
global.ssl_protocols: Avoid using old protocols (SSLv3, TLSv1.0, TLSv1.1) as they have security vulnerabilities.
global.ssl_ciphers: List of encryption algorithms. Keep updated for strong security.
global.ssl_session_cache: Caches SSL handshake info to speed up reconnections.
global.ssl_session_timeout: Duration to keep SSL session cache.
global.ssl_prefer_server_ciphers: Prioritize server's cipher suite preference over client's.
global.ssl_stapling: Speeds up certificate validation to reduce connection latency.
global.ssl_session_tickets: Resumes SSL sessions quickly using session tickets.
global.client_body_timeout: Closes connection if client sends data too slowly.
global.client_header_timeout: Closes connection if client sends headers too slowly.
global.send_timeout: Timeout for sending data to client.
global.proxy_connect_timeout: Timeout for connecting to backend server.
global.proxy_send_timeout: Timeout for sending data to backend server.
global.proxy_read_timeout: Time to wait for response from backend. Increase if you have slow API endpoints.
global.resolver: DNS server used to resolve domain names to IPs.
global.error_log_level: Detail level of error logs. 'warn' or 'error' recommended unless debugging.
global.access_log_enabled: Logs all access records. May require disk space management.
global.custom_http_config: Enter custom configuration to add to Nginx http block.
global.proxy_buffer_size: Buffer size for reading the first part (header) of upstream server response.
global.proxy_buffers: Number and size of buffers for buffering responses. Format: 'count size'
global.proxy_busy_buffers_size: Buffer size for sending partial response to client while upstream is still sending.
global.proxy_max_temp_file_size: Maximum size of temp file for storing response when buffers are full. Set to 0 to disable temp files.
global.proxy_temp_file_write_size: Size of data written to temp file at once.
global.open_file_cache_enabled: Cache file descriptors and metadata for static files. Improves performance for sites with many static files.
global.open_file_cache_max: Maximum number of entries to store in cache.
global.open_file_cache_inactive: Cache entries not accessed within this time are removed.
global.open_file_cache_valid: How often to check if cached entries are still valid.
global.open_file_cache_min_uses: Only files accessed this many times within inactive time are kept in cache.
global.open_file_cache_errors: Also cache file-not-found and similar errors.
global.reset_timedout_connection: Close timed out connections with RST packet. Quickly frees socket resources to improve server performance.
global.resolver_timeout: Maximum time to wait for DNS lookup response.
global.custom_stream_config: Nginx stream block configuration for TCP/UDP load balancing.

ddos.connectionLimit: Limits concurrent connections from same IP to protect server resources.
ddos.requestLimit: Limits requests per second from same IP to block excessive requests.
ddos.responseLimit: Limits download speed to prevent bandwidth monopoly.
ddos.bandwidthLimit: Limits client download speed to fairly distribute bandwidth.

geoip.enable: Enabling GeoIP allows you to block or allow traffic based on country. Requires a free MaxMind account.
geoip.account: You need a MaxMind Account ID and License Key to download the GeoLite2 database.
geoip.accountId: The 6-digit ID issued from your MaxMind account settings.
geoip.licenseKey: The license key generated from your MaxMind account.
geoip.updateInterval: Frequency to automatically update the GeoIP database.

acme.enable: Automatically issues and renews free SSL certificates from Let's Encrypt.
acme.email: Used for certificate expiration notifications and account recovery.
acme.staging: Use Staging for testing to avoid rate limits. Certificates are NOT trusted. Disable for production.
acme.renewBefore: Renew certificates this many days before expiration. Default (30) is recommended.

botfilter.defaults: These settings apply as defaults for NEW Proxy Hosts only. Existing hosts are unaffected.
botfilter.badBots: Blocks known bad bots like scrapers and spammers.
botfilter.aiBots: Blocks AI data scrapers like GPTBot and ClaudeBot.
botfilter.searchEngines: Always allow search engine crawlers (Google, Bing) to protect SEO.
botfilter.suspicious: Challenges suspicious clients (curl, python-requests) with a JavaScript challenge.

waf.autoBan: Automatically bans IPs that generate frequent WAF alerts (e.g., SQL Injection) within a short time.
waf.threshold: Ban IP if detection count exceeds this number within the window.
waf.duration: Duration to ban the IP. 0 means permanent ban.

maintenance.logRetention: Older logs are automatically deleted to save disk space. (Runs daily at midnight or on system restart)
maintenance.rawLogs: Save raw Nginx access/error logs to disk for external analysis or compliance.
maintenance.access: All HTTP request records including Bot Filter and Exploit block events. Used for traffic analysis.
maintenance.stats: Retention period for dashboard charts and statistics.

backup.enable: Automatically backup entire configuration at scheduled times.
backup.schedule: Backup schedule in Cron format (e.g., 0 2 * * * = Daily at 2 AM).
backup.retention: Maximum number of backup files to keep. Oldest backups are deleted when exceeded.
